ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Oh this can't be good.... (my last post on the topi c)
ygData.msgSnippet: I am merely writing to explain my words, not to spark a debate. I am not making a judgement on Abashi. I m not saying what is or what isn t his job to know.
ygData.messageBody:
I am merely writing to explain my words, not to spark a debate.

I am not making a judgement on Abashi. I'm not saying what is or what isn't
his job to know. All I was saying was that based on what he wrote in his
post, I don't think he was aware of what we were talking about.

Whether he should have known or could have known or used to know has nothing
to do with what I said.

Drae

-----Original Message-----
From: Ken Bachman [mailto:kbachman@...]
Sent: Tuesday, August 15, 2000 10:00 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Oh this can't be good....


Adam Wasserman wrote:
>
> Kit,
>
> I haven't been under a rock. (although it may have been safer there, maybe
I
> should try it) I've seen and contributed to many of the posts. But when I
> read Abashi's reply, I honestly believe he has absolutely no idea what we
> are talking about when we reference the problems with chains and lullaby.

Well, that's a real problem then. On the recently-wiped Gameplay board,
there are 10
separate posts with the words "chain" or "snare" in the titles which discuss
the nerf to
the level 23 song, and 13 separate posts with the words "lullaby" or "mez"
in the title
which discuss the problem with Lullaby and Pixie Strike. This doesn't
mention all the
other threads that discuss these topics that do not have the words in the
title.

HOW COULD HE NOT KNOW? Isn't it his JOB to know? Isn't he supposed to read
at LEAST the
first post in a new thread? Or does he just notice the word "bard" in the
title and blow
it off? I work a full-time job, and I STILL know what most of the major
issues are that
are bothering other players of ALL types, not just bards. Two months ago he
tells us that
Chains should not have been nerfed, and now he has no idea what we're
talking about? He
thinks that maybe someone somewhere mentioned in passing that Lullaby is
just fine, so that
makes it OK? I'm apoplectic.

It's like talking to a freaking rock.

Kenross Cantoforjado, 52 songs, Innoruuk



Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
